Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Puffy \Puff"y\, a. 1. Swelled with air, or any soft matter; tumid with a soft substance; bloated; fleshy; as, a puffy tumor. `` A very stout, puffy man.'' --Thackeray. [1913 Webster]
2. Hence, inflated; bombastic; as, a puffy style. [1913 Webster]

puffy adj 1: being puffed out; used of hair style or clothing; "a bouffant skirt" [syn: {bouffant}] 2: abnormally distended especially by fluids or gas; "hungry children with bloated stomachs"; "he had a grossly distended stomach"; "eyes with puffed (or puffy) lids"; "swollen hands"; "tumescent tissue"; "puffy tumid flesh" [syn: {bloated}, {distended}, {puffed}, {swollen}, {tumescent}, {tumid}, {turgid}] 3: breathing heavily [syn: {huffing}, {puffing}] [also: {puffiest}, {puffier}]
